description: Describes a measurement, calculation or setting capability of a medical device.

implicitRules.description: String of characters used to identify a name or a resource
implicitRules.title: uri

language.description: A string which has at least one character and no leading or trailing whitespace and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents
language.title: code

identifier.description: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by the device or gateway software, manufacturers, other organizations or owners. For example: handle ID.

items.description: An identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously. Typically this is used for business identifiers.

type.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

system.title: uri

items.title: Coding

type.title: CodeableConcept

system.description: String of characters used to identify a name or a resource
system.title: uri

period.description: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

start.description: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month).  If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored.                 Dates SHALL be valid dates.
start.title: dateTime

end.description: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month).  If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored.                 Dates SHALL be valid dates.
end.title: dateTime

type.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

type.title: CodeableConcept

system.description: String of characters used to identify a name or a resource
system.title: uri

period.description: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

end.description: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means no end was known or planned at the time the instance was created. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.

period.title: Period

assigner.description: A reference from one resource to another.

reference.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

type.description:
The expected type of the target of the reference. If both Reference.type and Reference.reference are populated and Reference.reference is a FHIR URL, both SHALL be consistent.

The type is the Canonical URL of Resource Definition that is the type this reference refers to. References are URLs that are relative to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ e.g. "Patient" is a reference to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient. Absolute URLs are only allowed for logical models (and can only be used in references in logical models, not resources).

identifier.description: An identifier for the target resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity it represents is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

assigner.title: Reference

type.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

items.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

system.description: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

version.description: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured, and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.

code.description: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).

display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

userSelected.description: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - e.g. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).

identifier.title: Identifier

assigner.title: Reference

identifier.title: Identifier

assigner.title: Reference

identifier.title: Identifier

assigner.title: Reference

identifier.title: Identifier

parent.title: Reference

operationalStatus.description: Indicates current operational state of the device. For example: On, Off, Standby, etc.
operationalStatus.title: "on"|"off"|"standby"|"entered-in-error"

color.description: Describes the color representation for the metric. This is often used to aid clinicians to track and identify parameter types by color. In practice, consider a Patient Monitor that has ECG/HR and Pleth for example; the parameters are displayed in different characteristic colors, such as HR-blue, BP-green, and PR and SpO2- magenta.
color.title: "black"|"red"|"green"|"yellow"|"blue"|"magenta"|"cyan"|"white"

category.description: Indicates the category of the observation generation process. A DeviceMetric can be for example a setting, measurement, or calculation.
category.title: "measurement"|"setting"|"calculation"|"unspecified"

measurementPeriod.description: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are planned, expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds, and may be used for reporting the schedule to which past regular activities were carried out.

event.description: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

items.description: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month).  If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored.                 Dates SHALL be valid dates.
items.title: dateTime

repeat.description: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are planned, expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds, and may be used for reporting the schedule to which past regular activities were carried out.

value.description: A rational number with implicit precision
value.title: decimal

comparator.description: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

system.description: String of characters used to identify a name or a resource
system.title: uri

code.description: A string which has at least one character and no leading or trailing whitespace and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents
code.title: code

boundsRange.description: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.

low.description: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.

value.description: A rational number with implicit precision
value.title: decimal

comparator.description: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

system.description: String of characters used to identify a name or a resource
system.title: uri

code.description: A string which has at least one character and no leading or trailing whitespace and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents
code.title: code

low.title: Quantity

high.description: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.

comparator.description: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

boundsRange.title: Range

boundsPeriod.description: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

start.description: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month).  If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored.                 Dates SHALL be valid dates.
start.title: dateTime

end.description: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month).  If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored.                 Dates SHALL be valid dates.
end.title: dateTime

boundsPeriod.title: Period

count.description: An integer with a value that is positive (e.g. >0)
count.title: positiveInt

countMax.description: An integer with a value that is positive (e.g. >0)
countMax.title: positiveInt

duration.description: A rational number with implicit precision
duration.title: decimal

durationMax.description: A rational number with implicit precision
durationMax.title: decimal

durationUnit.description: The units of time for the duration, in UCUM units.
durationUnit.title: "s"|"min"|"h"|"d"|"wk"|"mo"|"a"

frequency.description: An integer with a value that is positive (e.g. >0)
frequency.title: positiveInt

frequencyMax.description: An integer with a value that is positive (e.g. >0)
frequencyMax.title: positiveInt

period.description: A rational number with implicit precision
period.title: decimal

periodMax.description: A rational number with implicit precision
periodMax.title: decimal

periodUnit.description: The units of time for the period in UCUM units.
periodUnit.title: "s"|"min"|"h"|"d"|"wk"|"mo"|"a"

dayOfWeek.description: If one or more days of week is provided, then the action happens only on the specified day(s).

items.description: A string which has at least one character and no leading or trailing whitespace and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents
items.title: code

timeOfDay.description: Specified time of day for action to take place.

items.description: A time during the day, with no date specified
items.title: time

when.description: An approximate time period during the day, potentially linked to an event of daily living that indicates when the action should occur.

offset.description: An integer with a value that is not negative (e.g. >= 0)
offset.title: unsignedInt

repeat.title: Timing_Repeat

code.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

items.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

calibration.description: Describes the calibrations that have been performed or that are required to be performed.

items.description: Describes a measurement, calculation or setting capability of a medical device.

type.description: Describes the type of the calibration method.
type.title: "unspecified"|"offset"|"gain"|"two-point"

state.description: Describes the state of the calibration.
state.title: "not-calibrated"|"calibration-required"|"calibrated"|"unspecified"

time.description: An instant in time - known at least to the second
time.title: instant

items.title: DeviceMetric_Calibration
